intro: Rhamnus iguanea, commonly known as the Iguanea buckthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, green leaves and yellowish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It produces small, dark berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Rhamnus iguanea is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
